PERSIAN GULF RESIDENCY, BAHRAIN. Dated the 17th April 1948. Reference to previous correspondence: —■■■■—— . .. — . DESCRIPTION OF ENCLOSURE Foreign Office telegram No.21 dated the 13th April 1948. SUBJECT : PRO POSED RECOGNITION OF SEIF EL-ISLAM AHMED AS KING O'F YEMEN. NPG23/41 <1 Telegram Inter Indiv (CYPHER TELEGRAM - OTP - SECRET) From Foreign Office, London. To Washington. No.4084. Repeated Baghdad, for info Beirut. Cairo. Jeddah. B.M.E.O. Paris. Hague. Rome. Governor, Aden. Political Resident, Bahrain. i\o.21. Dated 13th, received 15th April 1948. Confidential. My telegram 425 Press (not to all). Proposed recognition of Seif el-Islam Ahmed as King of Yemen. Both Governor of Aden and French Vice-Consul (who has just returned from Sana*a via Hajja Hodeida and Taiz) report that Yemen is quiet and Ahmed’s power securely established. I have therefore decided that our recognition should be delayed no longer and am submitting for King’s approval text of a message from His Majesty to Ahmed congratulating him on his accession and expressing friendly sentiments. -* 2. I propose that this message together with one from me to Yemeni Foreign Minister, should be telegraphed to Bana’a by Governor of Aden on April 21st. Please ask State Department if this date would be convenient to them. 3. French Netherlands and Italian Embassies here are also being informed of our intentions, and we expect that their Governments will take similar action, though we understand that French Government are anxious to recognise Ahmed on the 14th. Government of Pakistan have suddenly announced their intention of recognising Ahmed on 13th. - S/S. for Foreign Affairs - j MGy 3 s/cs.

mods.abstract: This file contains a copy of a telegram sent from the Foreign Office in London to a number of British embassies and residencies globally on 13 April 1948. The telegram concerns the proposed recognition of Seif el-Islam Ahmed as the King of Yemen.The file also contains a covering letter that forwarded the copy from the Persian Gulf Political Resident in Bahrain to the Political Agents in Bahrain, Kuwait and Muscat.
